column4: mkv is a container file. you can put any video type inside an mkv.
as mkv being a container file, it might be that you have an unsupported codec hidden inside of it. I've had them with Real Media video in them before, that was a pain to get working.
yea but I have played the same video file earlier today and other mkv file (sam source) earlier both without and with problem...
open it with VLC, look at any errors it gives you. that's how I found out the one mkv I had had real video in it.
